Posts.Content: Hi Carol, I am sorry you are going this and i can relate... Keep fighting girl  and try not to be fearful.   I guess i have lived with mestatic Breast cancer for so long that I just take one day at a time.   I am on Zometa infusions and xeloda.   I am anemic and have had two blood transfusions, one is September and a second on Dec 1st. In January i am getting away for three weeks to go visit my daughter and granddaughter who live accross country.   I cant wait.   I need a break. Nancy Psalm 103:1 - 3
Posts.Title: Stage 4 Mestastic

Posts.Content: hey Christy your welcome, I am a breast cancer survivor too. I was first diagnosed at age 31 after having two children. I had a lumpectomy and radiation. I was clean for nineteen yrs and had followup during this time. At age 50 i was diagnosed with a second breast cancer. Five years later and it is now in my bones but i am doing well. I dont have pain and am undergoing treatment ( chemo pills) and a zometa infusion once a month. If it were not for my faith i dont know where i would be. Most people do not live with cancer as long as i have. I know its the power of a mighty God and the prayers of his people who have sustained me. I can only imagine the fear that is attacking your mind. Remember God is in control and he is able. Keep in touch via the boards here. I wish i could share my email address but they dont allow that. Remember God hath not given us the spirit of fear but of power and of love and of a sound mind. 2 timothy 1:7 God bless, Nancy
Posts.Title: Pregnant and Diagnosed With Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Christy, I am so sorry to read of your diagnosis of all times when you are expecting your third child. I really dont have any advice except if it were me i would trust God and have this baby then seek treatment. I will pray for you. sincerely Nancy

Posts.Content: Hi Ella, thanks for your message of encouragement. I just started on the oral Xeloda a week ago. So far i seem to be tolerating them well. Could you tell me as you get farther into the cycles if the side effects start up? I am wanting to go visit my daughter in a month or so. That means flying accross country. I would hate to get out there and not feel well, but i really want to.......... need to go. I have stage 4 Breast cancer with mets to the bones but still have good quality of life. I was on femara for a year and then my oncologist switched me to Aromasin. My blood work shows my tumor markers are up and i am anemic so hes trying the Xeloda. Sounds like you have been on it for a year, so thought i would see how you feel on it. thanks for any help ........ Nancy

Posts.Title: Living With Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I  did radiation and no major surgery.......... I had  two lumpectomys The first was at age 31.  The nodes were clean.  I chose not to do chemo or have a mastectomy.   At age 50  it came back  in the same breast.  It is now in my bones and i am now 55.   I am on chemo pills xeloda.  I am doing fairly well and have a good measure of health.    I am a born again believer and i dont fear or obsess about it, but trust the Lord.
